Articles.Content:
So the day is approaching and I found this while perusing my news feeds. Enjoy 

[http://m.nydailynews.com/news/world/apollo-11-lands-man-moon-1969-article-1.2294428](http://m.nydailynews.com/news/world/apollo-11-lands-man-moon-1969-article-1.2294428)

Nice find.

I've seen articles just last month about the [lunar dust cloud](http://www.space.com/29691-moon-dust-cloud-mystery-comets.html) which, in time, will be (speculated to) filling in small craters *and* the Apollo astronauts footprints. While not much can be done about that, the dust raised by rocket landings and such is an issue and concern, because the Apollo landing sites (and others) are of 'historical/heritage' value. The concern is such that NASA has drawn up guidelines for preservation, as [outlined here](https://www.nasa.gov/sites/default/files/617743main_NASA-USG_LUNAR_HISTORIC_SITES_RevA-508.pdf)... no-fly / no-go zones.
